str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A head of a household. From oikos and despotes; the head of a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shut fast, close, shut up. From apo and kleio; to close fully.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
To knock, beat a door with a stick, to gain admittance. Apparently a primary verb; to rap.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
